verses.text_plain: Thus saith the Lord; Behold, I will raise up against Babylon, and against them that dwell in the midst of them that rise up against me, a destroying wind;
verses.verse_html:
1Thus saith the Lord; Behold, I will raise up against Babylon, and against them that dwell in the midst of them that rise up against me, a destroying wind; ▼
▼ midst: Heb. heart

footnotes.body_html: ▼ midst: Heb. heart

verses.text_plain: And will send unto Babylon fanners, that shall fan her, and shall empty her land: for in the day of trouble they shall be against her round about.
verses.verse_html: 2And will send unto Babylon fanners, that shall fan her, and shall empty her land: for in the day of trouble they shall be against her round about.

tokens.text: they shall be against her round about

verses.text_plain: Against him that bendeth let the archer bend his bow, and against him that lifteth himself up in his brigandine: and spare ye not her young men; destroy ye utterly all her host.
verses.verse_html: 3Against him that bendeth let the archer bend his bow, and against him that lifteth himself up in his brigandine: and spare ye not her young men; destroy ye utterly all her host.

verses.text_plain: Thus the slain shall fall in the land of the Chaldeans, and they that are thrust through in her streets.
verses.verse_html: 4Thus the slain shall fall in the land of the Chaldeans, and they that are thrust through in her streets.

verses.text_plain: For Israel hath not been forsaken, nor Judah of his God, of the Lord of hosts; though their land was filled with sin against the Holy One of Israel.
verses.verse_html: 5For Israel hath not been forsaken, nor Judah of his God, of the Lord of hosts; though their land was filled with sin against the Holy One of Israel.

verses.text_plain: Flee out of the midst of Babylon, and deliver every man his soul: be not cut off in her iniquity; for this is the time of the Lord’s vengeance; he will render unto her a recompence.
verses.verse_html: 6Flee out of the midst of Babylon, and deliver every man his soul: be not cut off in her iniquity; for this is the time of the Lord’s vengeance; he will render unto her a recompence.

verses.text_plain: Babylon hath been a golden cup in the Lord’s hand, that made all the earth drunken: the nations have drunken of her wine; therefore the nations are mad.
verses.verse_html: 7Babylon hath been a golden cup in the Lord’s hand, that made all the earth drunken: the nations have drunken of her wine; therefore the nations are mad.

verses.text_plain: Babylon is suddenly fallen and destroyed: howl for her; take balm for her pain, if so be she may be healed.
verses.verse_html: 8Babylon is suddenly fallen and destroyed: howl for her; take balm for her pain, if so be she may be healed.

tokens.text: if so be she may be healed

verses.text_plain: We would have healed Babylon, but she is not healed: forsake her, and let us go every one into his own country: for her judgment reacheth unto heaven, and is lifted up even to the skies.
verses.verse_html: 9We would have healed Babylon, but she is not healed: forsake her, and let us go every one into his own country: for her judgment reacheth unto heaven, and is lifted up even to the skies.

verses.text_plain: The Lord hath brought forth our righteousness: come, and let us declare in Zion the work of the Lord our God.
verses.verse_html: 10The Lord hath brought forth our righteousness: come, and let us declare in Zion the work of the Lord our God.

verses.text_plain: Make bright the arrows; gather the shields: the Lord hath raised up the spirit of the kings of the Medes: for his device is against Babylon, to destroy it; because it is the vengeance of the Lord, the vengeance of his temple.
verses.verse_html:
11Make bright the arrows; gather the shields: the Lord hath raised up the spirit of the kings of the Medes: for his device is against Babylon, to destroy it; because it is the vengeance of the Lord, the vengeance of his temple. ▼
▼ bright: Heb. pure

footnotes.body_html: ▼ bright: Heb. pure

verses.text_plain: Set up the standard upon the walls of Babylon, make the watch strong, set up the watchmen, prepare the ambushes: for the Lord hath both devised and done that which he spake against the inhabitants of Babylon.
verses.verse_html:
12Set up the standard upon the walls of Babylon, make the watch strong, set up the watchmen, prepare the ambushes: for the Lord hath both devised and done that which he spake against the inhabitants of Babylon. ▼
▼ ambushes: Heb. liers in wait

footnotes.body_html: ▼ ambushes: Heb. liers in wait

verses.text_plain: O thou that dwellest upon many waters, abundant in treasures, thine end is come, and the measure of thy covetousness.
verses.verse_html: 13O thou that dwellest upon many waters, abundant in treasures, thine end is come, and the measure of thy covetousness.

verses.text_plain: The Lord of hosts hath sworn by himself, saying, Surely I will fill thee with men, as with caterpillers; and they shall lift up a shout against thee.
verses.verse_html:
14The Lord of hosts hath sworn by himself, saying, Surely I will fill thee with men, as with caterpillers; and they shall lift up a shout against thee. ▼
▼ by himself: Heb. by his soul
 , ▼
▼ lift up: Heb. utter

footnotes.body_text: ▼ by himself: Heb. by his soul
footnotes.body_html: ▼ by himself: Heb. by his soul
▼ lift up: Heb. utter

verses.text_plain: He hath made the earth by his power, he hath established the world by his wisdom, and hath stretched out the heaven by his understanding.
verses.verse_html: 15He hath made the earth by his power, he hath established the world by his wisdom, and hath stretched out the heaven by his understanding.

verses.text_plain: When he uttereth his voice, there is a multitude of waters in the heavens; and he causeth the vapours to ascend from the ends of the earth: he maketh lightnings with rain, and bringeth forth the wind out of his treasures.
verses.verse_html:
16When he uttereth his voice, there is a multitude of waters in the heavens; and he causeth the vapours to ascend from the ends of the earth: he maketh lightnings with rain, and bringeth forth the wind out of his treasures. ▼
▼ multitude: or, noise

footnotes.body_html: ▼ multitude: or, noise

verses.text_plain: Every man is brutish by his knowledge; every founder is confounded by the graven image: for his molten image is falsehood, and there is no breath in them.
verses.verse_html:
17Every man is brutish by his knowledge; every founder is confounded by the graven image: for his molten image is falsehood, and there is no breath in them. ▼
▼ is brutish…: or, is more brutish than to know

footnotes.body_text: ▼ is brutish…: or, is more brutish than to know
footnotes.body_html: ▼ is brutish…: or, is more brutish than to know

verses.text_plain: They are vanity, the work of errors: in the time of their visitation they shall perish.
verses.verse_html: 18They are vanity, the work of errors: in the time of their visitation they shall perish.

verses.text_plain: The portion of Jacob is not like them; for he is the former of all things: and Israel is the rod of his inheritance: the Lord of hosts is his name.
verses.verse_html: 19The portion of Jacob is not like them; for he is the former of all things: and Israel is the rod of his inheritance: the Lord of hosts is his name.

verses.text_plain: Thou art my battle axe and weapons of war: for with thee will I break in pieces the nations, and with thee will I destroy kingdoms;
verses.verse_html:
20Thou art my battle axe and weapons of war: for with thee will I break in pieces the nations, and with thee will I destroy kingdoms; ▼
▼ with thee: or, in thee, or, by thee

tokens.text: for with thee will I break in pieces
and with thee will I destroy

footnotes.body_text: ▼ with thee: or, in thee, or, by thee
footnotes.body_html: ▼ with thee: or, in thee, or, by thee

verses.text_plain: And with thee will I break in pieces the horse and his rider; and with thee will I break in pieces the chariot and his rider;
verses.verse_html: 21And with thee will I break in pieces the horse and his rider; and with thee will I break in pieces the chariot and his rider;

tokens.text: And with thee will I break in pieces
and with thee will I break in pieces

verses.text_plain: With thee also will I break in pieces man and woman; and with thee will I break in pieces old and young; and with thee will I break in pieces the young man and the maid;
verses.verse_html: 22With thee also will I break in pieces man and woman; and with thee will I break in pieces old and young; and with thee will I break in pieces the young man and the maid;

tokens.text: With thee also will I break in pieces
and with thee will I break in pieces
and with thee will I break in pieces

verses.text_plain: I will also break in pieces with thee the shepherd and his flock; and with thee will I break in pieces the husbandman and his yoke of oxen; and with thee will I break in pieces captains and rulers.
verses.verse_html: 23I will also break in pieces with thee the shepherd and his flock; and with thee will I break in pieces the husbandman and his yoke of oxen; and with thee will I break in pieces captains and rulers.

tokens.text: I will also break in pieces
and with thee will I break in pieces
and with thee will I break in pieces

verses.text_plain: And I will render unto Babylon and to all the inhabitants of Chaldea all their evil that they have done in Zion in your sight, saith the Lord.
verses.verse_html: 24And I will render unto Babylon and to all the inhabitants of Chaldea all their evil that they have done in Zion in your sight, saith the Lord.

verses.text_plain: Behold, I am against thee, O destroying mountain, saith the Lord, which destroyest all the earth: and I will stretch out mine hand upon thee, and roll thee down from the rocks, and will make thee a burnt mountain.
verses.verse_html: 25Behold, I am against thee, O destroying mountain, saith the Lord, which destroyest all the earth: and I will stretch out mine hand upon thee, and roll thee down from the rocks, and will make thee a burnt mountain.

tokens.text: upon thee, and roll thee down

verses.text_plain: And they shall not take of thee a stone for a corner, nor a stone for foundations; but thou shalt be desolate for ever, saith the Lord.
verses.verse_html:
26And they shall not take of thee a stone for a corner, nor a stone for foundations; but thou shalt be desolate for ever, saith the Lord. ▼
▼ desolate…: Heb. everlasting desolations

footnotes.body_html: ▼ desolate…: Heb. everlasting desolations

verses.text_plain: Set ye up a standard in the land, blow the trumpet among the nations, prepare the nations against her, call together against her the kingdoms of Ararat, Minni, and Ashchenaz; appoint a captain against her; cause the horses to come up as the rough caterpillers.
verses.verse_html: 27Set ye up a standard in the land, blow the trumpet among the nations, prepare the nations against her, call together against her the kingdoms of Ararat, Minni, and Ashchenaz; appoint a captain against her; cause the horses to come up as the rough caterpillers.

verses.text_plain: Prepare against her the nations with the kings of the Medes, the captains thereof, and all the rulers thereof, and all the land of his dominion.
verses.verse_html: 28Prepare against her the nations with the kings of the Medes, the captains thereof, and all the rulers thereof, and all the land of his dominion.

verses.text_plain: And the land shall tremble and sorrow: for every purpose of the Lord shall be performed against Babylon, to make the land of Babylon a desolation without an inhabitant.
verses.verse_html: 29And the land shall tremble and sorrow: for every purpose of the Lord shall be performed against Babylon, to make the land of Babylon a desolation without an inhabitant.

verses.text_plain: The mighty men of Babylon have forborn to fight, they have remained in their holds: their might hath failed; they became as women: they have burned her dwellingplaces; her bars are broken.
verses.verse_html: 30The mighty men of Babylon have forborn to fight, they have remained in their holds: their might hath failed; they became as women: they have burned her dwellingplaces; her bars are broken.

verses.text_plain: One post shall run to meet another, and one messenger to meet another, to shew the king of Babylon that his city is taken at one end,
verses.verse_html: 31One post shall run to meet another, and one messenger to meet another, to shew the king of Babylon that his city is taken at one end,

verses.text_plain: And that the passages are stopped, and the reeds they have burned with fire, and the men of war are affrighted.
verses.verse_html: 32And that the passages are stopped, and the reeds they have burned with fire, and the men of war are affrighted.

verses.text_plain: For thus saith the Lord of hosts, the God of Israel; The daughter of Babylon is like a threshingfloor, it is time to thresh her: yet a little while, and the time of her harvest shall come.
verses.verse_html:
33For thus saith the Lord of hosts, the God of Israel; The daughter of Babylon is like a threshingfloor, it is time to thresh her: yet a little while, and the time of her harvest shall come. ▼
▼ it is…: or, in the time that he thresheth her

footnotes.body_text: ▼ it is…: or, in the time that he thresheth her
footnotes.body_html: ▼ it is…: or, in the time that he thresheth her

verses.text_plain: Nebuchadrezzar the king of Babylon hath devoured me, he hath crushed me, he hath made me an empty vessel, he hath swallowed me up like a dragon, he hath filled his belly with my delicates, he hath cast me out.
verses.verse_html: 34Nebuchadrezzar the king of Babylon hath devoured me, he hath crushed me, he hath made me an empty vessel, he hath swallowed me up like a dragon, he hath filled his belly with my delicates, he hath cast me out.

verses.text_plain: The violence done to me and to my flesh be upon Babylon, shall the inhabitant of Zion say; and my blood upon the inhabitants of Chaldea, shall Jerusalem say.
verses.verse_html:
35The violence done to me and to my flesh be upon Babylon, shall the inhabitant of Zion say; and my blood upon the inhabitants of Chaldea, shall Jerusalem say. ▼
▼ The violence…: Heb. My violence
 , ▼
▼ flesh: or, remainder
 , ▼
▼ inhabitant: Heb. inhabitress

tokens.text: done to me and to my flesh

footnotes.body_html: ▼ The violence…: Heb. My violence
▼ flesh: or, remainder
▼ inhabitant: Heb. inhabitress

verses.text_plain: Therefore thus saith the Lord; Behold, I will plead thy cause, and take vengeance for thee; and I will dry up her sea, and make her springs dry.
verses.verse_html: 36Therefore thus saith the Lord; Behold, I will plead thy cause, and take vengeance for thee; and I will dry up her sea, and make her springs dry.

verses.text_plain: And Babylon shall become heaps, a dwellingplace for dragons, an astonishment, and an hissing, without an inhabitant.
verses.verse_html: 37And Babylon shall become heaps, a dwellingplace for dragons, an astonishment, and an hissing, without an inhabitant.

verses.text_plain: They shall roar together like lions: they shall yell as lions’ whelps.
verses.verse_html:
38They shall roar together like lions: they shall yell as lions’ whelps. ▼
▼ yell: or, shake themselves

footnotes.body_html: ▼ yell: or, shake themselves

verses.text_plain: In their heat I will make their feasts, and I will make them drunken, that they may rejoice, and sleep a perpetual sleep, and not wake, saith the Lord.
verses.verse_html: 39In their heat I will make their feasts, and I will make them drunken, that they may rejoice, and sleep a perpetual sleep, and not wake, saith the Lord.

tokens.text: and I will make them drunken

verses.text_plain: I will bring them down like lambs to the slaughter, like rams with he goats.
verses.verse_html: 40I will bring them down like lambs to the slaughter, like rams with he goats.

verses.text_plain: How is Sheshach taken! and how is the praise of the whole earth surprised! how is Babylon become an astonishment among the nations!
verses.verse_html: 41How is Sheshach taken! and how is the praise of the whole earth surprised! how is Babylon become an astonishment among the nations!

verses.text_plain: The sea is come up upon Babylon: she is covered with the multitude of the waves thereof.
verses.verse_html: 42The sea is come up upon Babylon: she is covered with the multitude of the waves thereof.

verses.text_plain: Her cities are a desolation, a dry land, and a wilderness, a land wherein no man dwelleth, neither doth any son of man pass thereby.
verses.verse_html: 43Her cities are a desolation, a dry land, and a wilderness, a land wherein no man dwelleth, neither doth any son of man pass thereby.

verses.text_plain: And I will punish Bel in Babylon, and I will bring forth out of his mouth that which he hath swallowed up: and the nations shall not flow together any more unto him: yea, the wall of Babylon shall fall.
verses.verse_html: 44And I will punish Bel in Babylon, and I will bring forth out of his mouth that which he hath swallowed up: and the nations shall not flow together any more unto him: yea, the wall of Babylon shall fall.

tokens.text: that which he hath swallowed up
any more unto him: yea, the wall

verses.text_plain: My people, go ye out of the midst of her, and deliver ye every man his soul from the fierce anger of the Lord.
verses.verse_html: 45My people, go ye out of the midst of her, and deliver ye every man his soul from the fierce anger of the Lord.

verses.text_plain: And lest your heart faint, and ye fear for the rumour that shall be heard in the land; a rumour shall both come one year, and after that in another year shall come a rumour, and violence in the land, ruler against ruler.
verses.verse_html:
46And lest your heart faint, and ye fear for the rumour that shall be heard in the land; a rumour shall both come one year, and after that in another year shall come a rumour, and violence in the land, ruler against ruler. ▼
▼ lest: or, let not

footnotes.body_html: ▼ lest: or, let not

verses.text_plain: Therefore, behold, the days come, that I will do judgment upon the graven images of Babylon: and her whole land shall be confounded, and all her slain shall fall in the midst of her.
verses.verse_html:
47Therefore, behold, the days come, that I will do judgment upon the graven images of Babylon: and her whole land shall be confounded, and all her slain shall fall in the midst of her. ▼
▼ do…: Heb. visit upon

footnotes.body_html: ▼ do…: Heb. visit upon

verses.text_plain: Then the heaven and the earth, and all that is therein, shall sing for Babylon: for the spoilers shall come unto her from the north, saith the Lord.
verses.verse_html: 48Then the heaven and the earth, and all that is therein, shall sing for Babylon: for the spoilers shall come unto her from the north, saith the Lord.

verses.text_plain: As Babylon hath caused the slain of Israel to fall, so at Babylon shall fall the slain of all the earth.
verses.verse_html:
49As Babylon hath caused the slain of Israel to fall, so at Babylon shall fall the slain of all the earth. ▼
▼ As…: or, Both Babylon is to fall, O ye slain of Israel, and with Babylon, etc
 , ▼
▼ the earth: or, the country

footnotes.body_text: ▼ As…: or, Both Babylon is to fall, O ye slain of Israel, and with Babylon, etc
footnotes.body_html: ▼ As…: or, Both Babylon is to fall, O ye slain of Israel, and with Babylon, etc
▼ the earth: or, the country

verses.text_plain: Ye that have escaped the sword, go away, stand not still: remember the Lord afar off, and let Jerusalem come into your mind.
verses.verse_html: 50Ye that have escaped the sword, go away, stand not still: remember the Lord afar off, and let Jerusalem come into your mind.

verses.text_plain: We are confounded, because we have heard reproach: shame hath covered our faces: for strangers are come into the sanctuaries of the Lord’s house.
verses.verse_html: 51We are confounded, because we have heard reproach: shame hath covered our faces: for strangers are come into the sanctuaries of the Lord’s house.

verses.text_plain: Wherefore, behold, the days come, saith the Lord, that I will do judgment upon her graven images: and through all her land the wounded shall groan.
verses.verse_html: 52Wherefore, behold, the days come, saith the Lord, that I will do judgment upon her graven images: and through all her land the wounded shall groan.

verses.text_plain: Though Babylon should mount up to heaven, and though she should fortify the height of her strength, yet from me shall spoilers come unto her, saith the Lord.
verses.verse_html: 53Though Babylon should mount up to heaven, and though she should fortify the height of her strength, yet from me shall spoilers come unto her, saith the Lord.

verses.text_plain: A sound of a cry cometh from Babylon, and great destruction from the land of the Chaldeans:
verses.verse_html: 54A sound of a cry cometh from Babylon, and great destruction from the land of the Chaldeans:

verses.text_plain: Because the Lord hath spoiled Babylon, and destroyed out of her the great voice; when her waves do roar like great waters, a noise of their voice is uttered:
verses.verse_html: 55Because the Lord hath spoiled Babylon, and destroyed out of her the great voice; when her waves do roar like great waters, a noise of their voice is uttered:

verses.text_plain: Because the spoiler is come upon her, even upon Babylon, and her mighty men are taken, every one of their bows is broken: for the Lord God of recompences shall surely requite.
verses.verse_html: 56Because the spoiler is come upon her, even upon Babylon, and her mighty men are taken, every one of their bows is broken: for the Lord God of recompences shall surely requite.

verses.text_plain: And I will make drunk her princes, and her wise men, her captains, and her rulers, and her mighty men: and they shall sleep a perpetual sleep, and not wake, saith the King, whose name is the Lord of hosts.
verses.verse_html: 57And I will make drunk her princes, and her wise men, her captains, and her rulers, and her mighty men: and they shall sleep a perpetual sleep, and not wake, saith the King, whose name is the Lord of hosts.

verses.text_plain: Thus saith the Lord of hosts; The broad walls of Babylon shall be utterly broken, and her high gates shall be burned with fire; and the people shall labour in vain, and the folk in the fire, and they shall be weary.
verses.verse_html:
58Thus saith the Lord of hosts; The broad walls of Babylon shall be utterly broken, and her high gates shall be burned with fire; and the people shall labour in vain, and the folk in the fire, and they shall be weary. ▼
▼ The broad…: or, The walls of broad Babylon
 , ▼
▼ broken: or, made naked

footnotes.body_text: ▼ The broad…: or, The walls of broad Babylon
footnotes.body_html: ▼ The broad…: or, The walls of broad Babylon
▼ broken: or, made naked

verses.text_plain: The word which Jeremiah the prophet commanded Seraiah the son of Neriah, the son of Maaseiah, when he went with Zedekiah the king of Judah into Babylon in the fourth year of his reign. And this Seraiah was a quiet prince.
verses.verse_html:
59The word which Jeremiah the prophet commanded Seraiah the son of Neriah, the son of Maaseiah, when he went with Zedekiah the king of Judah into Babylon in the fourth year of his reign. And this Seraiah was a quiet prince. ▼
▼ with: or, on the behalf of
 , ▼
▼ quiet…: or, prince of Menucha, or, chief chamberlain

footnotes.body_text: ▼ with: or, on the behalf of
footnotes.body_html: ▼ with: or, on the behalf of

footnotes.body_text: ▼ quiet…: or, prince of Menucha, or, chief chamberlain
footnotes.body_html: ▼ quiet…: or, prince of Menucha, or, chief chamberlain

verses.text_plain: So Jeremiah wrote in a book all the evil that should come upon Babylon, even all these words that are written against Babylon.
verses.verse_html: 60So Jeremiah wrote in a book all the evil that should come upon Babylon, even all these words that are written against Babylon.

verses.text_plain: And Jeremiah said to Seraiah, When thou comest to Babylon, and shalt see, and shalt read all these words;
verses.verse_html: 61And Jeremiah said to Seraiah, When thou comest to Babylon, and shalt see, and shalt read all these words;

verses.text_plain: Then shalt thou say, O Lord, thou hast spoken against this place, to cut it off, that none shall remain in it, neither man nor beast, but that it shall be desolate for ever.
verses.verse_html:
62Then shalt thou say, O Lord, thou hast spoken against this place, to cut it off, that none shall remain in it, neither man nor beast, but that it shall be desolate for ever. ▼
▼ desolate: Heb. desolations

tokens.text: but that it shall be desolate

footnotes.body_html: ▼ desolate: Heb. desolations

verses.text_plain: And it shall be, when thou hast made an end of reading this book, that thou shalt bind a stone to it, and cast it into the midst of Euphrates:
verses.verse_html: 63And it shall be, when thou hast made an end of reading this book, that thou shalt bind a stone to it, and cast it into the midst of Euphrates:

tokens.text: And it shall be, when thou hast made an end

verses.text_plain: And thou shalt say, Thus shall Babylon sink, and shall not rise from the evil that I will bring upon her: and they shall be weary. Thus far are the words of Jeremiah.
verses.verse_html: 64And thou shalt say, Thus shall Babylon sink, and shall not rise from the evil that I will bring upon her: and they shall be weary. Thus far are the words of Jeremiah.

tokens.text: upon her: and they shall be weary
